Social media postings claimed that 40: 000 mail-in ballots were rejected in DeKalb County, Georgia, in the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
DeKalb County debunked the claim via Twi: stating that only about 200 ballots needed to be cured and the affected voters were being contacted.
ProPublica reporter and CNN analyst Jess: 000 rejected ballots would be an "insanely high" amount, considering it would be almost 25% of all the mail-in ballots in that county.
